result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandie C Schiller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions. Sign releases.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

No Contact with the individual listed in the criminal complaint. Comply with all other court orders from any other cases. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Straight Time. Sentence credit of 29 days were granted. Time Served.
Unpaid previously imposed costs were converted to a civil judgment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandie C Schiller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Brandie C Schiller
Current: 934 W Mineral St, Milwaukee, WI 53204 United States  (Effective: 04-01-2016)
Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
pretrial incarceration sheet filed by Attorney Weitzner

Defendant Brandie C Schiller in court, in custody, with Attorney Cameron Weitzner.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing on revocation.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Weitzner makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

30 DAYS JAIL   (29 DAYS CREDIT)   **TIME SERVED**

Any outstanding fines/fees due are converted to civil judgment
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 18, 2016 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandie C Schiller
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 03-08-2016)
Prior: 3026 S. 92nd Street Apt. #5, West Allis, WI 53214 United States
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brandie C Schiller in court with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Bricco makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR    **Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: individual listed in criminal complaint 
____Comply with all other court orders from any other cases

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

 *Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations*

Defendant Brandie C Schiller in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bricco requests a plea and sentence date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brandie C Schiller in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states that she has not gone to the PD's office for an evaluation and she is not represented by counsel at this time. Court orders the Defendant to go to the PD's office for an evaluation.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Brandie C Schiller in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.
